Key Match Events: Both Canada and Argentina come into Tuesday’s contest off the back of quarter-final victories on penalty kicks.
Argentina were forced to the spot after Ecuador’s Kevin Rodríguez scored a stoppage-time equalizer in a 1-1 draw.

Lionel Messi hit the bar on a Panenka with Argentina’s first penalty, but they were perfect thereafter while goalkeeper Emi Martínez continued his dominance in shootouts saving two of Ecuador’s efforts.

Canada were also tied 1-1 after 90 minutes against Venezuela in their quarter-final, and after five rounds of penalty kicks. But in sudden death pens, Max Crépeau continued his tournament heroics with a save on Wilker Ángel before Ismaël Koné stepped up and won the match for Canada with a coolly taken penalty kick.
Pre-Game Insights: Canada face Lionel Messi and Argentina in the semifinal of a Copa América with a spot in the final on the line.
The group stage meeting between these two sides on June 20 ended in a 2-0 victory for Argentina, despite a strong performance from Canada.
This is a Canadian team in their first Copa América going up against an Argentina side who have reached this stage in six of the last seven tournaments — and progressed to the final five times.
Argentina have won this competition 15 times, including the most recent edition in 2021.
Canada will enter this match as the overwhelming underdog.
Canada coach Jesse Marsch said, '[It] will have to be the best match we’ve ever played and it still might not be enough. But, whatever. We’re going to go for it.'
Both Canada and Argentina come into Tuesday’s contest off the back of quarter-final victories on penalty kicks.

For Argentina, after scoring late against Canada in the tournament’s opening match as a substitute, Inter Milan’s Lautauro Martínez has taken the tournament by storm, scoring a competition-leading four goals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 2024 Copa América final is the next day at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami, Florida on Sunday, July 14.
If Canada want to reach the final match, they will need to be far more clinical than they have been so far under Marsch.
Since winning the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar, Argentina have kept 14 clean sheets in 18 matches.
Canada’s rise at this competition has been perhaps best personified by that of Jacob Shaffelburg.
Shaffelburg was a real headache for Argentina in his half-hour cameo off the bench in the tournament opener, despite playing his off-wing.
Projected lineups for Argentina: E. Martínez; Tagliafico, Li. Martínez, Romero, Molina; Di Maria, De Paul, Mac Allister, González; Messi, La. Martínez.
Projected lineups for Canada: Crépeau; Johnston, Bombito, Cornelius, Davies; Shaffelburg, Eustáquio, Koné, Laryea; David, Larin.
All-time series: Argentina wins: 2  Canada wins: 0  Draws: 0.
Match officials: Referee: Piero Maza (CHI), ARs: Claudio Urrutia (CHI), Jose Retamal (CHI), 4th Official: Christian Garay (CHI), VAR: Juan Lara (CHI).
